Description: Large hammerstone made of greyish-whitish granite in a spherical shape. The outer surface is roughly smoothed. The underside shows a depression with a diameter of 2.5 cm that is probably ware from usage as a hammerstone. The opposite side has a small area that is very well smoothed onto which the excavation number was written later. Not clear if the area was smoothed for this purpose.
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 133)
